    • Method Detail

      • createProgressBar

        public static java.lang.String createProgressBar​(@NotNull
                                                 @org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull double size,
                                                 @NotNull
                                                 @org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull double percentage,
                                                 @NotNull
                                                 @org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull boolean monospace,
                                                 @NotNull
                                                 @org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull boolean includePercentage,
                                                 @NotNull
                                                 @org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull boolean includeBrackets)
        Create a horizontal progress bar, similar to how htop does it.

        Returns a progress bar

        Parameters:
        size - The size of the bar (inside)
        percentage - The percentage to fill the bar to
        monospace - If false, the bars will be a character with the equivalent amount of pixels as a whitespace character
        includePercentage - If true, the percentage will be appended inside of outside of the bar, depending on how much whitespace is available
        includeBrackets - If true, the progress bar will return wrapped in snuggly brackets
        Returns:
        String

      • capitaliseSentence

        public static java.lang.String capitaliseSentence​(@NotNull
                                                  @NotNull java.lang.String string,
                                                  @NotNull
                                                  @NotNull java.lang.Boolean keepCase)
        Capitalise every letter after whitespace.

        This will also lowercase any uppercase characters.

        Example: "hello world" == "Hello World"

        Example: "hello WORLD" == "Hello World" || "Hello WORLD" depending on the `keepCase` input

        Returns a message with capital letters after every whitespace

        See capitaliseSentenceKeepUpperCase(String)

        Parameters:
        string - The string to capitalise
        keepCase - Whether or not to keep the uppercase characters
        Returns:
        String

      • capitaliseSentence

        public static java.lang.String capitaliseSentence​(@NotNull
                                                  @NotNull java.lang.String string)
        Capitalise every letter after whitespace.

        This will also lowercase any uppercase characters.

        Example: "hello world" == "Hello World"

        Example: "HELLO WORLD" == "Hello World"}

        Returns a message with capital letters after every whitespace

        See Alternate (keeping uppercase): capitaliseSentenceKeepUpperCase(String)

        Parameters:
        string - The string to capitalise
        Returns:
        String

      • capitaliseSentenceKeepUpperCase

        public static java.lang.String capitaliseSentenceKeepUpperCase​(@NotNull
                                                               @NotNull java.lang.String string)
        Capitalise every letter after whitespace.

        Will keep uppercase letters uppercase.

        Example: "hello world" == "Hello World"

        Example: "hello WORLD" == "Hello WORLD"

        See Alternate (not keeping uppercase): capitaliseSentence(String)

        Returns a message with capital letters after every whitespace

        Parameters:
        string - The string to capitalise
        Returns:
        String
        Since:
        2.0

      • replaceLeet

        public static java.lang.String replaceLeet​(@NotNull
                                           @NotNull java.lang.String message)
        Filter "Leet Speak" out of a message

        Example: 

         Translation.replaceLeet("50m3 1337 5p34k h3r3") = "some leet speak here"

        The filtered message

        Parameters:
        message - The message to filter
        Returns:
        String

      • startsWithIgnoreCase

        public static boolean startsWithIgnoreCase​(@NotNull
                                           @NotNull java.lang.String string,
                                           @NotNull
                                           @NotNull java.lang.String prefix)
        This method uses a region to check case-insensitive equality. This means the internal array does not need to be copied like a toLowerCase() call would.
        Parameters:
        string - String to check
        prefix - Prefix of string to compare
        Returns:
        Boolean
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if prefix or string is null

      • hyphenateUUID

        public static java.util.UUID hyphenateUUID​(@NotNull
                                           @NotNull java.lang.String uuid)
        Put hyphens into a uuid

        e.x. de8c89e12f25424d8078c6ff58db7d6e > de8c89e1-2f25-424d-8078-c6ff58db7d6e

        Parameters:
        uuid - to hyphenate
        Returns:
        UUID
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if uuid string is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if uuid is not 32 characters and is invalid

                                                      int max,
                                                      int minRunBeforeSpace)
        Creates a random string of "magic" characters of characters
        Parameters:
        min - the minimum length of the string (inclusive)
        max - the maximum length of the string (inclusive)
        minRunBeforeSpace - Minimum number of characters before a space can appear, set to 0 to disable space
        Returns:
        A string of random characters, where the length
        Since:
        3.0

      • formatChatCodes

        public static java.lang.String formatChatCodes​(java.lang.String input)
        Replaces & followed by any valid minecraft format code (matching the regex 
         (?=([a-f]|[0-9]|[klmnor]))
        with §
        Parameters:
        input - The input string
        Returns:
        A string where the relevant ampersands are replaced with section symbols
        Since:
        3.0
